page.title: 19MEMORIES
page.content: I spoke to my great uncle Alex about what it was like here when he was a young boy. He is 72 now and he has always lived in Queenzieburn. The children were afraid of the teachers, who strapped them on the hand when they were bad. Out of school they played games we still play today-skipping,football,peevers,kick the can,hide and seek,rounders and cricket. At the time he started work down the pit there were 9 pits around the district. Now there are none. His first wage was 3 shillings and 4 pence (about 17p). A loaf cost fourpence and a dozen eggs cost sixpence(2p and 3p). Although people had little money and fewer luxuries in his young days my great uncle Alex says people were more contented than they are nowadays.
